intro: Ione salweenensis, commonly known as the Salween ioneweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species in botanical studies.
